Intervention: * Trinegative breast cancer (TBT) treated with trinegative breast cancer (TBT) treated with Nivolumab IV 240 mg Q2W (weeks 3-24) + Daratumumab IV 16 mg/kg Q1W (weeks 1-8), Daratumumab IV 16 mg/kg Q2W (weeks 9-24)
* Non-small cell lung cancer (NCLC) treated with Nivolumab IV 240 mg Q2W (weeks 3-24) + Daratumumab IV 16 mg/kg Q1W (weeks 1-8), Daratumumab IV 16 mg/kg Q2W (weeks 9-24)
Eligibility: For more information on participation in Bristol-Myers Squibb clinical trials, please visit www.BMSSstudyConnect.com.
Patients with metastatic or advanced solid tumours
Women with triple negative breast cancer confirmed histologically or cytologically
Participants with histologically or cytologically confirmed pancreatic adenocarcinoma
Participants with non-small cell lung cancer confirmed by histology or cytology (NCSLC)
Active brain metastases or leptomeningal metastases.
Any serious or uncontrolled medical condition
A previous malignancy active in the previous 3 years
Other inclusion/exclusion criteria defined by the Protocol may apply.
Results: Number of participants with adverse reactions (ARs)

Number of participants with adverse reactions (ADRs) classified according to common terminology criteria for adverse reactions (CTCAE v4.0) to determine the safety and safety of Nivolumab and Daratumumab
Time: from the first dose to 30 days after the last dose (up to 34 months)

Description of the arm/group: Trinegative breast cancer (TBT) treated with trinegative breast cancer (TBT) treated with Nivolumab IV 240 mg Q2W (weeks 3-24) + Daratumumab IV 16 mg/kg Q1W (weeks 1-8), Daratumumab IV 16 mg/kg Q2W (weeks 9-24)
Type of measure: Number of participants
Description of the arm/group: Non-small cell lung cancer (NCLC) treated with Nivolumab IV 240 mg Q2W (weeks 3-24) + Daratumumab IV 16 mg/kg Q1W (weeks 1-8), Daratumumab IV 16 mg/kg Q2W (weeks 9-24)
Type of measure: Number of participants
